page.title: 08LANGUAGE SURVEY ERDINGTON
page.content: The main language at home is English other languages spoken by people in our class include French and German. At home some family members speak Gaelic, Welsh and Arabic. In the street survey most people thought it important to speak different languages. Only a small percentage spoke more than one foreign language - usually French or Gaelic. Most people came across foreign language speakers in their daily life-speakers of Italian, Gaelic and Hindi in Birmingham. There are many dialect words, e.g. Wally means idiot-Granny basher means an unfashionable person-dosser is someone who does no work-duranies are Duran Duran fans and Brummies are people who live in Birmingham.
